/*
Demonstrates text encoding scheme and decoder as used in "Quine in One Frame"

Explanation of the Quine follows:

Arrays are built at compile-time using the x-macro preprocessor technique.  By
defining, undefining, and redefining the repeated 'a' macro called within, the
array is used in two different ways.  To draw the definitions themselves, each
element is treated as a base-10 number and thus each digit is extracted
using integer division and modulo by 10.  Each element encodes four characters
of source code using base-97; the appropriate source code character for a given
on-screen position is thus extracted from the aray using integer division and
modulo by 97.  The constant 97 is chosen to allow 95 different characters
(32 to 126) and a value of 96 to be used to indicate a newline. Newline handling
is convoluted but consists of offsetting which element of the array is used
according to how many elements containing newlines have already been processed
and to their relative positions.  Each decimal-represented base-97 value has
10000000 added to it to eliminate leading zeros, which would cause compilation
errors, whereas leading spaces would increase the complexity of the
definition-drawing code.  The constant chosen is 97 rather than 100 so that the
highest four-digit value that can be encoded, plus 10000000, which is
97^4-1 + 10000000 = 98529280, is less than 99999999 and thus fits within eight
digits in source form.  Only four digits of base-97 are encoded per element so
as not to overflow the 32-bit signed integers they are compiled into.

Copyright (c) 2016, Theron Tarigo.
All rights reserved.
Encoder and decoder may be used under the terms of the 2-Clause BSD License;
see end of file.
*/

vec2 decode(vec2 uv, ivec2 pagesize) {
    vec2 v=fract(uv*vec2(pagesize));
    int x=int(floor(uv.x*float(pagesize.x)));
    int y=int(floor((1.-uv.y)*float(pagesize.y)));
    int o=-1;
    int i=0;
    int q=0;
    int r=0;
    int pos=x+128*y;
    int n=(pos/4);
    int m=(pos-4*n);
    int l=-1;
    int e=((m<3)?97:1)*((m<2)?97:1)*((m<1)?97:1);
	#define a(b){q=(b-10000000);r=q/e-97*(q/e/97);o=n==i?r:o;if(n>i&&q-97*(q/97)==96){o=-1;n-=32-i+l;l=i;}}i++;
	STRING
	#undef a
    if (o==-1||o==96||x<0||y<0||x>pagesize.x||y>pagesize.y) o=0;
    return vec2(.25+.5*v.x+mod(float(o+32),16.),0.85*v.y+15.02-float(o/16+2))/16.;
}

void mainImage(out vec4 fragColor, in vec2 fragCoord){
    vec2 u=((fragCoord.xy)/iResolution.xy-vec2(0.5))/0.9+vec2(0.5);
    ivec2 pagesize = ivec2(80,24);
    fragColor.rgb=vec3(1.-texture(iChannel0,decode(u,pagesize)).r);
}

// Text is encoded using the following Python 2/3 program:
/*

f = open("text.txt","r")
text = f.read()
f.close()

lines = [line.ljust((len(line)//4+1)*4-1," ") for line in text.split('\n')]
text = "\n".join(lines)+"    "*10

# mode=1 when 26 lines or fewer are needed as in case of quine
# mode=2 for extended range (max. 676 lines) such as used by explanation
mode=2

def encode4(ch):
    a = 0
    for i in range(4):
        a*=97
        b = ord(ch[i])-32
        if ch[i]=='\n':
            b=96
        if 0<=b and b<97:
            a+=b
    return str(a+10000000).rjust(8," ")

for ln in range(len(text)//40):
    if ln==0:
        if mode==1:
            prefix = "#define A   "
        if mode==2:
            prefix = "#define AA    "
    else:
        if mode==1:
            prefix = "#define %s %s "%(chr(65+ln%26),chr(65+(ln-1)%26))
        if mode==2:
            prefix = "#define %s%s %s%s "%(chr(65+ln//26),chr(65+ln%26),chr(65+(ln-1)//26),chr(65+(ln-1)%26))
    textline = text[ln*40:ln*40+40]
    defline = ""
    for i in range(10):
        defline += "a("+encode4(textline[4*i:4*(i+1)])+")"
    print(prefix+defline)

*/
